Need help reading this?

isString

Listen: events delegation system

From: https://github.com/cferdinandi/events https://github.com/cferdinandi/events/blob/master/src/js/events/events.js

isString

EventCallback

EventCallback

Type: function (event: AnyDOMEvent<TType>, desiredTarget: TTarget): any

ListenEvent

ListenEvent

Type: {selector: string, callback: EventCallback}

Properties
selector (string)
callback (EventCallback)

activeEvents

Active events

activeEvents

Type: Partial<Record<AnyDOMEventType, Array<ListenEvent>>>

getIndex

Get the index for the listener

getIndex(arr: Array<ListenEvent>, selector: string, callback: EventCallback)
Parameters
arr (Array<ListenEvent>)
selector (string)
callback (EventCallback)

getRunTarget

Check if the listener callback should run or not

getRunTarget(target: Element, selector: (string | Window | Document | Element)): any
Parameters
target (Element) The event.target
selector ((string | Window | Document | Element)) The selector/element to check the target against
Returns
any: If not false, run listener and pass the targeted element to use in the callback

eventHandler

Handle listeners after event fires

eventHandler(event: Event)
Parameters
event (Event)

$

Sizzle/jQuery like DOM nodes shortcut for document.querySelector To avoid an extra function call we inline the above escape

$(selector: string, parent: (HTMLElement | Document | null)?, avoidEscape: boolean?)
Parameters
selector (string) DOM selector
parent ((HTMLElement | Document | null)?) It falls back to window.document
avoidEscape (boolean?) Whether to avoid escaping : in the selector string
Example

Basic DOM selection

const $container = $(".my-section:");
const $el = $("[data-some-attr]", $container);

$$

Sizzle/jQuery like DOM nodes shortcut for document.querySelectorAll To avoid an extra function call we inline the above escape

$$(selector: string, parent: (Element | HTMLElement | Document | null)?, avoidEscape: boolean?, string: any)
Parameters
selector (string)
parent ((Element | HTMLElement | Document | null)?) It falls back to window.document
avoidEscape (boolean?) Whether to avoid escaping : in the selector string
string (any) selector DOM selector

$each

Each shortcut, iterate through a NodeList of HTMLElements retrieved with the given selector (and optionally a parent container passed as thrid arguement)

$each(selector: string, callback: function ($element: T, index: number): any, parent: HTMLElement?, scope: object?)
Parameters
selector (string) DOM selector
callback (function ($element: T, index: number): any)
parent (HTMLElement?) It falls back to window.document
scope (object?)

addClass

Add class shortcut

addClass(el: T?, className: any)
Parameters
el (T?)
className (any = "")

createElement

Shortcut for document.createElement, allowing to to create an HTML element with a given className directly (a very common use case)

createElement(type: string, className: string?)
Parameters
type (string)
className (string?)

emitEvent

Emit event (use only if the targeted browser supports CustomEvents)

emitEvent(type: any, detail: any)
Parameters
type (any = "customEvent")
detail (any = {})

escapeSelector

Escape colons to allow use class names as .module:block__element

escapeSelector(selector: string)
Parameters
selector (string)
Related
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/querySelector#Escaping_special_characters

exists

Checks if passed node exist and is a valid element.

exists(node: Element?)
Parameters
node (Element?)

forEach

For each, iterate through a NodeList or an array of HTMLElements

forEach(nodes: (NodeListOf<T> | Array<T>), callback: function (this: TScope, $element: T, index: number): any, scope: TScope?)
Parameters
nodes ((NodeListOf<T> | Array<T>))
callback (function (this: TScope, $element: T, index: number): any)
scope (TScope?) The optional this of the callback function

getDataAttr

Get data attribute

getDataAttr(element: HTMLElement, attribute: string)
Parameters
element (HTMLElement)
attribute (string) The name of the data-{attr}

getDocumentHeight

Determine the document's height

getDocumentHeight()
Related
https://github.com/cferdinandi/smooth-scroll (credits)

getHeight

Get element height

getHeight(element: HTMLElement)
Parameters
element (HTMLElement)

getListeners

Get an immutable copy of all active event listeners

getListeners(): any
Returns
any: Active event listeners

getOffset

Get an element's distance from the top and left of the Document.

getOffset(elem: HTMLElement): any
Parameters
elem (HTMLElement) The HTML node element
Returns
any: Distance from the top and left in pixels

getOffsetTop

Get an element's distance from the top of the Document.

getOffsetTop(elem: HTMLElement): any
Parameters
elem (HTMLElement) The HTML node element
Returns
any: Distance from the top in pixels
Related
https://vanillajstoolkit.com/helpers/getoffsettop/

getOffsetTopSlim

Get an element's distance from the top of the Document (using more modern/performant technique compared to ./getOffsetTop)

getOffsetTopSlim(elem: HTMLElement): any
Parameters
elem (HTMLElement) The HTML node element
Returns
any: Distance from the top in pixels
Related
https://stackoverflow.com/q/5598743/1938970

getScrollbarWidth

Get scrollbar's current width

getScrollbarWidth(element: HTMLElement?)
Parameters
element (HTMLElement?)

getStyleValue

Return the current style value for an element CSS property

getStyleValue(el: HTMLElement, prop: string)
Parameters
el (HTMLElement) The element to compute
prop (string) The style property

getVisualBackgroundColor

Get the background color of an element eventually looking recursively into its parents, if nothing is found it returns a #fff background

getVisualBackgroundColor(elem: (null | HTMLElement)?): string
Parameters
elem ((null | HTMLElement)?)
Returns
string

injectCss

Inject css

injectCss(id: string, cssString: any, root: Document)
Parameters
id (string)
cssString (any = "")
root (Document = document)

isHidden

Is element hidden?

isHidden(el: HTMLElement?)
Parameters
el (HTMLElement?)

isInViewport

Determine if an element is in the viewport

isInViewport(elem: Element): any
Parameters
elem (Element) The element
Returns
any: Returns true if element is in the viewport

isNodeList

Is node list

isNodeList(nodes: any): any

any

isTotallyScrolled

isTotallyScrolled(el: HTMLElement?)
Parameters
el (HTMLElement?)
Related
https://github.com/willmcpo/body-scroll-lock/blob/master/src/bodyScrollLock.js#L116 https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/scrollHeight#Problems_and_solutions

listen

Listen an event

listen(types: TTypes, selector: string, callback: EventCallback<TTarget, TTypes>)
Parameters
types (TTypes) The event type or types (comma separated)
selector (string) The selector to run the event on
callback (EventCallback<TTarget, TTypes>) The function to run when the event fires

listenLoaded

Fires a callback when the DOM content is loaded

listenLoaded(handler: function (event: Event): any)
Parameters
handler (function (event: Event): any)
Related
https://mathiasbynens.be/notes/settimeout-onload

listenOnce

Listen an event, and automatically unlisten it after it's first run

listenOnce(types: string, selector: string, callback: EventCallback)
Parameters
types (string) The event type or types (comma separated)
selector (string) The selector to run the event on
callback (EventCallback) The function to run when the event fires

listenResize

Listen element's (window by default) scroll event

listenResize
Parameters
handler (function (): void)
el (AnyDOMEventTargetLoose?)
Returns
any: An automatic unbinding function to run to deregister the listener upon call

listenResizeDebounced

listenResizeDebounced

args (...Parameters<any>)
Returns
any: An automatic unbinding function to run to deregister the listener upon call

off

Shortcut for removeEventListener

off(el: AnyDOMEventTargetLoose, type: TType, handler: function (event: AnyDOMEvent<TType>): void, options: (EventListenerOptions | boolean))
Parameters
el (AnyDOMEventTargetLoose)
type (TType)
handler (function (event: AnyDOMEvent<TType>): void)
options ((EventListenerOptions | boolean) = false)

on

Shortcut for addEventListener

on(el: AnyDOMEventTargetLoose, type: TType, handler: function (event: AnyDOMEvent<TType>): void, options: (AddEventListenerOptions | boolean)): any
Parameters
el (AnyDOMEventTargetLoose)
type (TType)
handler (function (event: AnyDOMEvent<TType>): void)
options ((AddEventListenerOptions | boolean) = false)
Returns
any: An automatic unbinding function to run to deregister the listener upon call

once

One shot listener, it addEventListener and removes it first time is called with removeEventListener

once(el: AnyDOMEventTargetLoose, type: string, handler: EventListener, options: (EventListenerOptions | boolean))
Parameters
el (AnyDOMEventTargetLoose)
type (string)
handler (EventListener)
options ((EventListenerOptions | boolean) = false)

removeClass

Remove class shortcut

removeClass(el: T?, className: any)
Parameters
el (T?)
className (any = "")

scrollTo

Native scrollTo, "smooth" and with callback

scrollTo(destination: number, callback: function (): void?, fallbackTimeout: number?, behavior: ScrollBehavior?, offset: any)
Parameters
destination (number)
callback (function (): void?) callback function
fallbackTimeout (number?) this appears to be needed in some hard to reproduce scenario on safari, where the callback seem to be never called
behavior (ScrollBehavior? = "smooth")
offset (any) offset to scroll to

setDataAttr

Set data attribute

setDataAttr(element: Element, attribute: string, value: (string | number | null | boolean)?)
Parameters
element (Element)
attribute (string) The name of the data-{attr}
value ((string | number | null | boolean)?) The value to set, null or undefined will remove the attribute

setVendorCSS

Set vendor CSS rule

setVendorCSS(element: HTMLElement, prop: string, value: (string | number | boolean))
Parameters
element (HTMLElement) A single HTMLElement
prop (string) CSS rule proerty
value ((string | number | boolean)) The CSS value to set, it will be automatically vendor prefixed

siblings

Finds siblings nodes of the passed node.

siblings(node: Element)
Parameters
node (Element)

toArray

Node list to array

toArray(nodeList: (NodeListOf<T> | HTMLFormControlsCollection))
Parameters
nodeList ((NodeListOf<T> | HTMLFormControlsCollection))

AnyDOMEventTargetLoose

We use it either throwing an error on unexisting element or falling back to window in case of scroll or resize events

AnyDOMEventTargetLoose

Type: (AnyDOMEventTarget | AnythingFalsy)

AnyDOMEventTargetLoose

We use it either throwing an error on unexisting element or falling back to window in case of scroll or resize events

AnyDOMEventTargetLoose

Type: (AnyDOMEventTarget | AnythingFalsy)

List here the global variables used by third party scripts supported within the koine ecosystem.

unlisten

Stop listening for an event

unlisten(types: TTypes, selector: string, callback: EventCallback<TTarget, TTypes>)
Parameters
types (TTypes) The event type or types (comma separated)
selector (string) The selector to remove the event from
callback (EventCallback<TTarget, TTypes>) The function to remove
